title: The Bald Eagle
description: The Bald Eagle is a bird of prey found in North America. It is the national bird and national animal of the United States and is known for its distinctive white head and tail.

questions.question: What is the Bald Eagle's primary food source?
A group of eagles is known by what collective noun?
How do Bald Eagles typically build their nests?
options: They dig burrows in the ground
They build large, stick nests at the top of tall trees or on cliffs
They build them in abandoned buildings
questions.correct_answer: They build large, stick nests at the top of tall trees or on cliffs

questions.question: Why is the Bald Eagle called 'bald'?
options: It loses its feathers as it ages
It has no feathers on its head
Its head is a pale color

questions.question: At what age do Bald Eagles typically acquire their white head and tail feathers?
